intro: Sisymbrium choiquense, commonly known as the Choique mustard, is a flowering plant native to South America, particularly Argentina. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes many other mustard plants. The plant typically grows in arid or semi-arid regions and is characterized by its small, yellow flowers and compound leaves. Sisymbrium choiquense is often found in disturbed soils and is adapted to thrive in harsh environmental conditions. It plays a role in local ecosystems by providing nectar for pollinators and contributing to soil stabilization.
